title: Secondo uno studio dell'università di Urbino l'algoritmo di Facebook ora punisce la politica ufficiale e premia gli estremisti antieuropei. Pd e FdI verso una legge bipartisan sulle piattaforme
snippet: A study by the University of Urbino, authored by Professor Fabio Giglietto, analyzes the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on the distribution and visibility of political content on Facebook and Instagram. The study highlights transparency deficits, noting that algorithmic suppression appears less effective against extremists. The research analyzed over 2.5 million posts on Facebook published between 2021 and 2025.
description: This article from Open discusses a study by the University of Urbino, authored by Professor Fabio Giglietto, which analyzes the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on political content distribution, highlighting transparency deficits.

title: The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - Vera.ai
snippet: This article discusses a vera.ai project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto, Massimo Terenzi, and Richard Rogers at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam.  The project analyzed a dataset of Facebook stories identified as problematic by fact-checkers, using GPT models and Mistral AI to identify topics and assess the persistence of misinformation. The research focused on consumer fraud scams, misinformation regarding Emmanuel Macron, and health-related stories.
description: This article on vera.ai discusses a project facilitated by Fabio Giglietto at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam, focusing on the persistence of misinformation using AI models and a dataset of Facebook stories.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: This page references Fabio Giglietto's work on coordinated link sharing behavior and his expertise in the field of misinformation. He discusses how coordinated inauthentic behavior can be a signal to spot misinformation and his research on COVID-19 misinformation in Italy.

Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, along with Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni from the University of Urbino, presented research at conferences in Brazil in October 2025 focusing on disinformation, social media, and climate change.  Giglietto moderated a roundtable on data access in the DSA era and presented collaborative research using large language models (LLMs) to analyze political discourse on Facebook, with a focus on capturing cultural and linguistic nuances. Giada Marino also presented a study on how deceptive operations evolve online.
description: This vera.ai post describes Fabio Giglietto's participation in conferences in Brazil where he presented research on disinformation and social media, including the use of LLMs for analyzing political discourse on Facebook.
